Module com.jlbabilino.json
Package com.jlbabilino.json

Interface TypeMarker<T>

public interface TypeMarker<T>
This interface is used to hold type information at runtime. The user is intended to create anonymous inner instances of this class to be passed into the deserializer.

When deserializing JSON, it is essential to know the Java type to deserialize to, and it originally may appear that a Class object is sufficient. This fails when deserializing generics, which is why TypeMarker exists.

This method of holding type information at runtime is basically a hack that gets around type erasure. When an anonymous inner class is created off of this interface, Java automatically converts it to a nested static class at compile-time. This class can be introspected with Java reflection, which can look at the superinterfaces of this inner class and can get the generic type parameters of the TypeMarker. Here's an example of a private, static, final member of class TypeMarkerExample of type TypeMarker called marker that holds Map&lt;String, Integer&gt;: 

 public class TypeMarkerExample {
     private static final TypeMarker<Map<String, Integer>> marker = new TypeMarker<>() {
     };
 }

This gets converted to: 

 public class TypeMarkerExample {
     private static class TypeMarkerExample$0 implements TypeMarker<Map<String, Integer>> {
     }
 
     private static final TypeMarker<Map<String, Integer>> marker = new TypeMarkerExample$0();
 }

The deserializer then looks at the type parameter in the TypeMarker after the implements statement, and determines the type.

See Also:
JSONDeserializer
